Package asciipanel

Class AsciiPainter

java.lang.Object
asciipanel.AsciiPainter
public class AsciiPainter
extends java.lang.Object
An instance of AsciiPainter exposes methods to draw graphics into an AsciiRaster instance, called the surface. In order to draw into an AsciiRaster, one can create an instance of AsciiPainter and use its methods to draw something. All methods support chaining to enhance readability and ease of use. A painter works like a pen, defined by a position (specified by properties penX and penY), a foreground color and a background color (specified by properties foregroundColor and backgroundColor). When drawing methods are invoked, the drawings will appear at the position of the pen and with the colors of the pen.
Author:
Lorenzo Bianchi

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    AsciiPainter​(AsciiRaster surface)
    Create a new painter instance with the specified surface.

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    AsciiPainter background​(java.awt.Color color)
    Sets the background color to be used for painting.

    Sets the brush to be used for drawing lines.
    AsciiPainter clear()
    Clear the entire surface to whatever the default background color is.
    AsciiPainter clear​(char character)
    Clear the entire surface with the specified character and whatever the default foreground and background colors are.
    AsciiPainter drawDot()
    Draws a single dot with the active brush at the pen's position.

    Draws a line with the active brush from the pen's position to (penX + deltaX, penY + deltaY).
    AsciiPainter drawLineTo​(int endX, int endY)
    Draws a line with the active brush from the pen's position to (endX, endY).

    Draws a given raster into the surface, with optional transparency.
    AsciiPainter drawRasterChars​(AsciiRaster raster, boolean transparent, boolean center)
    Draws characters from a given raster into the surface, with optional transparency.
    AsciiPainter fill​(char character)
    Runs a flood-fill algorithm starting from the position of the pen, filling a contiguous area of the surface with the specified character and current background and foreground colors.

    • clear

      public AsciiPainter clear​(char character)

      Parameters:
      character - the character to write
      Returns:
      this for convenient chaining of method calls

    • fillRectTo

      public AsciiPainter fillRectTo​(char character, int endX, int endY)
      Fills an axis-aligned rectangle with the specified character and current background and foreground colors. The area to fill is determined by its diagonal: one end of the diagonal is given by the position of the pen and the other end is given by arguments (endX, endY). The end coordinates (endX and endY) are excluded from the fill area. The position of the pen is updated to (endX, endY). The filled rectangle is clipped to the surface area: if the coordinates lie outside the surface, only the part that lies inside will be filled.
      Parameters:
      character - the character that will be used to fill the rectangle
      endX - horizontal coordinate of the second end of the diagonal
      endY - vertical coordinate of the second end of the diagonal
      Returns:
      this for convenient chaining of method calls

    • fillRect

      public AsciiPainter fillRect​(char character, int width, int height)
      Fills an axis-aligned rectangle with the specified character, width and height and current background and foreground colors. One corner of the rectangle is given by the pen position, width and height of the rectangle are given by method parameters. The position of the pen is moved to the opposite corner of the rectangle, as if by calling this.move(width, height). If width is negative, the rectangle is drawn above the pen position. If height is negative, the rectangle is drawn to the left of the pen position. The filled rectangle is clipped to the surface area: if the coordinates lie outside the surface, only the part that lies inside will be filled.
      Parameters:
      character - the character that will be used to fill the rectangle
      width - width of the rectangle to fill
      height - height of the rectangle to fill
      Returns:
      this for convenient chaining of method calls

    • write

      public AsciiPainter write​(char character)
      Write a character to the pen's position. This updates the pen's position by moving one step to the right, as if by calling this.move(1, 0). If the pen's position is outside the surface area, nothing is drawn but the pen is updated.
      Parameters:
      character - the character to write
      Returns:
      this for convenient chaining of method calls

    • write

      public AsciiPainter write​(java.lang.String string)
      Write a string to the pen's position. This updates the pen's position as if by calling this.move(string.length(), 0). If the pen's position is or goes outside the surface area, only the part of the string inside the surface is drawn.
      Parameters:
      string - the string to write
      Returns:
      this for convenient chaining of method calls

    • writeCenter

      public AsciiPainter writeCenter​(java.lang.String string)
      Write a string to the center of the panel at the vertical position of the pen. This moves the pen's position to the end of the string. If the pen's position is or goes outside the surface area, only the part of the string inside the surface is drawn.
      Parameters:
      string - the string to write
      Returns:
      this for convenient chaining of method calls

    • fill

      public AsciiPainter fill​(char character)
      Runs a flood-fill algorithm starting from the position of the pen, filling a contiguous area of the surface with the specified character and current background and foreground colors. The fill algorithm stops as soon as it finds a character different from the one in the starting position. If the current position of the pen is outside the surface area, the algorithm starts from the nearest position that is inside the area.
      Parameters:
      character - character used to fill
      Returns:
      this for convenient chaining of method calls

    • drawRaster

      public AsciiPainter drawRaster​(AsciiRaster raster, boolean transparent, boolean center)
      Draws a given raster into the surface, with optional transparency. The raster is drawn with the upper left corner (or optionally the center) placed at the pen's position. Only the part of the raster that lies inside the surface is drawn.
      Parameters:
      raster - the raster to draw
      transparent - when true, cells of the raster that have character equal to 0 will not be drawn
      center - when true, the center of the raster is placed at the pen's position
      Returns:
      this for convenient chaining of method calls

    • drawRasterChars

      public AsciiPainter drawRasterChars​(AsciiRaster raster, boolean transparent, boolean center)
      Draws characters from a given raster into the surface, with optional transparency. The raster is drawn with the upper left corner (or optionally the center) placed at the pen's position. This method draws only draws characters from the raster, using current background and foreground colors of the pen. Only the part of the raster that lies inside the surface is drawn.
      Parameters:
      raster - the raster to draw
      transparent - when true, cells of the raster that have character equal to 0 will not be drawn
      center - when true, the center of the raster is placed at the pen's position
      Returns:
      this for convenient chaining of method calls

    • drawDot

      public AsciiPainter drawDot()
      Draws a single dot with the active brush at the pen's position. If the pen is outside the surface area, nothing is drawn.
      Returns:
      this for convenient chaining of method calls

    • drawLineTo

      public AsciiPainter drawLineTo​(int endX, int endY)
      Draws a line with the active brush from the pen's position to (endX, endY). The pen is moved to (endX, endY). Only the part of the line that intersects the surface area is drawn.
      Parameters:
      endX - horizontal coordinate of the first endpoint of the line
      endY - vertical coordinate of the second endpoint of the line
      Returns:
      this for convenient chaining of method calls

    • drawLine

      public AsciiPainter drawLine​(int deltaX, int deltaY)
      Draws a line with the active brush from the pen's position to (penX + deltaX, penY + deltaY). The pen is moved as if by calling this.move(deltaX, deltaY).
      Parameters:
      deltaX - value to be added to the horizontal coordinate of the pen
      deltaY - value to be added to the vertical coordinate of the pen
      Returns:
      this for convenient chaining of method calls
